content: the House of the bill was never a happy one
the loveless marriage of the Baron and Baroness de Vil as well as the dour
servants kept the household in a gloomy state
young master Manson de Ville was an unloved child the only joiners life came
from a magnificent toy his aunt had given to him before her untimely death a
wonderful miniature carousel then the PAC's came the servants and tenants died
so quickly they could barely bury each other in the end piles of unburied
bodies littered the grounds the Lord and Lady de Ville died in separate rooms two
testing each other to the grave although a good fortune did smile on them in the
end as they were to be buried in separate mausoleums you could spend
eternity not having to be near it with another young Manson was the last to
break the morrocoy he died clutching the only thing that meant anything to him
the miniature carousel now he roams the grounds looking for playmates to play
